intro: Spermadictyon scabrum, commonly known as the rough spermadictyon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rugged stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
